Package jabs.consensus.blockchain

Class LocalBlockDAG<B extends Block<B>>

Object
LocalBlockDAG<B>
Type Parameters:
B - The block type that this DAG supports
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalBlockTree
public class LocalBlockDAG<B extends Block<B>> extends Object
A DAG graph of blocks received by a node. Each node in the network should have a local DAG of all blocks received. In a Nakamoto Consensus, for example, there is only one main chain and the blocks outside that chain are stale blocks.

    genesisBlock

    A map that receives a Block and returns corresponding LocalBlock on local DAG of the node.

  • Field Details

    • localBlockDAG

      protected final HashMap<B extends Block<B>,LocalBlock<B extends Block<B>>> localBlockDAG
      A map that receives a Block and returns corresponding LocalBlock on local DAG of the node.

    • genesisBlock

      private final LocalBlock<B extends Block<B>> genesisBlock
      The genesis block in the local DAG. The block with no parents. This should be set at the first. Since genesis block is fixed for any network node.

  • Constructor Details

    • LocalBlockDAG

      public LocalBlockDAG(B genesisLocalBlock)
      Creates the local DAG block of a node.
      Parameters:
      genesisLocalBlock - The block with no parents in the network

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(B block)
      Adds a received block from network to the local DAG block.
      Parameters:
      block - received block from the network or generated inside the node itself.

    • getLocalBlock

      public LocalBlock<B> getLocalBlock(B block)
      For any network block returns a local block inside the DAG. If it does not exist in the local DAG then returns null.
      Parameters:
      block - the network block
      Returns:
      The corresponding local block

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns total number of blocks inside the local block DAG.
      Returns:
      Number of blocks inside the local block DAG.

    • getGenesisBlock

      public B getGenesisBlock()
      Returns the block wih no parents that was set in initialization of the node
      Returns:
      genesis block

    • getChildren

      public HashSet<B> getChildren(B block)
      Returns all the children of a block in the local block DAG
      Parameters:
      block - the network block
      Returns:
      A map of all children of the block in local block DAG

    • contains

      public boolean contains(B block)
      Checks if a certain network block is available in the local block DAG of the node.
      Parameters:
      block - the network block to check if it exists in the local block DAG
      Returns:
      true if the block exists in the local DAG, and false if it is not.

    • getChildlessBlocks

      public Set<B> getChildlessBlocks()
      Returns all the childless blocks (tips, leaves) that exist of the local block DAG of the node.
      Returns:
      set of all available childless blocks in the local block DAG

    • getDanglingBlocks

      public Set<B> getDanglingBlocks()
      Returns set of all blocks in local DAG block that does not have any parents available in the local block DAG.
      Returns:
      set of Dangling blocks or blocks with no parents already received from the network.

    • areBlocksConnected

      public boolean areBlocksConnected(B block1, B block2)
      Determines if two blocks are connected to each other or not. If all block between the two input blocks are already available inside the local block DAG then returns true else returns false
      Parameters:
      block1 - first block
      block2 - second block
      Returns:
      true if there is a path between the two blocks and all block between them are available inside the local block DAG else fasle.

    • getBiconeBetweenBlocks

      public HashSet<B> getBiconeBetweenBlocks(B block1, B block2)
      Returns all the blocks between two provided blocks inside local block DAG if there is blocks has this property
      Parameters:
      block1 - first block
      block2 - second block
      Returns:
      the list of all blocks between the two input block, starting from the one with higher height block.

    • getAllAncestors

      public HashSet<B> getAllAncestors(B block)
      Returns a hashset of all ancestors of the input block that are available in the local block DAG
      Parameters:
      block - the block which its ancestors are requested
      Returns:
      all ancestors in the local block DAG

    • getAllAncestorsWithMinHeight

      public HashSet<B> getAllAncestorsWithMinHeight(B block, int minHeight)
      Returns a hashset of all ancestors of the input block that are available in the local block DAG and has a height larger than input height
      Parameters:
      block - the block which its ancestors are requested
      minHeight - minimum height of the ancestor blocks
      Returns:
      all ancestors in the local block DAG

    • getAncestorsWithHeight

      public HashSet<B> getAncestorsWithHeight(B block, int height)
      Returns a hashset of all ancestors of the input block with certain height that are available in the local block DAG
      Parameters:
      block - the block which its ancestors are requested
      height - the height of the ancestors
      Returns:
      all ancestors in the local block DAG

    • getSuccessorsWithHeight

      public HashSet<B> getSuccessorsWithHeight(B block, int height)
      Returns a SortedSet of all available Successors of the input block with certain height inside local block DAG.
      Parameters:
      block - the block of which the successors are requested
      height - the height of the successors
      Returns:
      SortedSet of all available Successors of the input block inside the local block DAG with certain height.

    • getAllSuccessors

      public HashSet<B> getAllSuccessors(B block)
      Returns a SortedSet of all available Successors of the input block inside local block DAG
      Parameters:
      block - the block of which the successors are requested
      Returns:
      SortedSet of all available Successors of the input block inside the local block DAG.

    • getAllSuccessorsWithMaxHeight

      public HashSet<B> getAllSuccessorsWithMaxHeight(B block, int height)
      Returns a SortedSet of all available Successors of the input block inside local block DAG that have height below a certain height
      Parameters:
      block - the block of which the successors are requested.
      height - Maximum height
      Returns:
      SortedSet of all available Successors of the input block inside the local block DAG that has a height less than the input value.
